ceng453.backend.services.auth

Interface IAuthenticationService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AuthenticationService

    @Service
public interface IAuthenticationService

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> login(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      It will check if the username and password is correct.
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> logout(java.lang.String token)
      It will check if the token is valid.
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> register(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String passwordRememberQuestion)
      It will check if the token is valid.
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> remindPassword(java.lang.String username)
      It will remind the password of the user determined at the registration of the corresponding user.
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> resetPassword(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String token)
      It will reset the password of the user determined at the registration of the corresponding user.
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> resetPasswordRequest(java.lang.String username)
      It will start the procedure of password reset of the user and send a token for resetting his/her password.

    • Method Detail

      • login

        org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> login(java.lang.String username,
                                                            java.lang.String password)
        It will check if the username and password is correct. If it is correct, it will return the token.
        Parameters:
        username - It is the unique username of the user
        password - It is the password of the user
        Returns:
        A base response defined in the BaseResponse class

      • register

        org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> register(java.lang.String username,
                                                               java.lang.String email,
                                                               java.lang.String password,
                                                               java.lang.String passwordRememberQuestion)
        It will check if the token is valid. If it is valid, it will return the success message and will email to user's email.
        Parameters:
        username - It is the unique username of the user
        email - It is the email of the user
        password - It is the password of the user
        passwordRememberQuestion - It is the password remember question of the user. When user request it, it will be sent to the user
        Returns:
        A base response defined in the BaseResponse class

      • logout

        org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> logout(java.lang.String token)
        It will check if the token is valid. If it is valid, it will return the success message and logout the user.
        Parameters:
        token - It is the token of the user with expiration time.
        Returns:
        A base response defined in the BaseResponse class

      • remindPassword

        org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> remindPassword(java.lang.String username)
        It will remind the password of the user determined at the registration of the corresponding user.
        Parameters:
        username - It is the unique username of the user
        Returns:
        A base response defined in the BaseResponse class

      • resetPasswordRequest

        org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> resetPasswordRequest(java.lang.String username)
        It will start the procedure of password reset of the user and send a token for resetting his/her password. The token will be sent via an email.
        Parameters:
        username - It is the unique username of the user
        Returns:

      • resetPassword

        org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> resetPassword(java.lang.String username,
                                                                    java.lang.String password,
                                                                    java.lang.String token)
        It will reset the password of the user determined at the registration of the corresponding user.
        Parameters:
        username - It is the unique username of the user
        password - It is new password of the user
        token - It is the token sent in the email.
        Returns:
